div.head: Page 2
div.p:
Som remarks as under. of Our Sister Martha Powellâ€™s Life
(viz)
I was Born Feby. 12. 1704 in Norly Near Oxford, in England My Father Tho Prichett was by Trade a Cooper he liv'd verry Natralnatural. conserningconcerning himself with Religon like others of the Church of England. He was earnest in putting me to a Dancing School as also much delighted in seeing me Exersiseexcercise & practise the same

My Mother was brought up and liv'd a Quaker till the time of her Marriage on which Day she was Baptised. She had an uncommon affection & desierdesire for the salvation of Her Children, which extraordinary appeared in her lingering illness often speaking of our Dr. Saviours Merritsmerits on which she trusted Committing the care of her little ones to him with prayers & many Tears she

div.head: Page 3
div.p: She Deceas'd yongyoung - at the 5th year of my Age. & in my tender years I drank in the Delights of the World. as Dancing & mirth, with all viggourvigor yet often in Church I was Disolv'd in tears in hearing the Epistelsepistles & Gospels Read, & perticulerparticular such as mention'd the Passion & Suffering of our Dr Saviour

But on my being under a step-mother, at my 15th year I left them Hieringhiring my self out, from place To place in Oxford where on Acct of my fine aire in Dancing I was much esteem.d by the Rich jentreygentry

About thne 1735 & 31st year of my Age I became at times trubilledtroubled & uneasy by means of som Low preachers that kept society meetings in the Cittycity. at which time I liv.d with the Rever'd Mr. Wilder whoswhose Wife on perceiving my Behaviour chang'd her temper us.d all possible means to to turn & Divert me from it. but onas she therby avail.d nothing she chang'd her
her behaviour to all reviling, cursing & the most vulgar scandellousscandalous expressions, on which I left her.

After this I once being sent for earnestly desieringdesiring I'deI'd comcome to a great Ball of Gentelmen & Ladies but on my refusing there came to me one of these, assheweringassuring me the Ball could not be properly carried on without me, on which I consented but just in the beginingbeginning of this my last Dance I was struck with such Small Pox Anguish, pain,& Horrourhorror that I with hasthaste got out, earnestly beseeching the Lord to bare & have mercy on me, in so great a Sin, against better knowledgknowledge - this was the heaviest Night I (as yet) ever felt # At the end of Powell's memoir there is a passage about Small pox: "About this time the Gentlewoman I served sent her yongyoung Daughter in my care to a Neighbour wherwhere the Small Pox was on purpose to catch it, but to no effect. But our Dr. Saviour knowing the danger I was still in of loosinglosing my soul, I being still fill'd with passion, pride, & and self admiration He laid me down on the Small Pox (tho it was not then in our Neighbourhood) in which I believe I suffered much more, yea woodwould much rather die. This put such a stop to those Miserys that still lay in me that I thank'd Him for this unspeakbale Mercy" now I kept diligent to my sociateysociety meeting. As also to Church, & Sacrament, every Sonday. With, & amongst the so cal'dcalled Methodists. as which time Br. Kenchin J. Gambold & somsome others kept the Meetings
Once about the year 39 I had the most Hellish Night wherin my Eyes ware

div.head: Page 4
div.p: warewere never clos'd. Satan to all my Apprehencionapprehension stood by my Bed. continualleycontinually suggesting that as I had serv'd him I was his property & belong'd of Right to him - In the Morning came Br. Kenchin with other of the friends whom I much dislik'd being miserable & unhappy. the which he perciev'dperceived using many means to get me to sit with him & his friends as a sort of a feast of love. when his subject & what he spoke was such & adapted in perticulerparticular to me the same pressing floods of tears from my eyes notwhithstanding I just before had been nothing but Enmity. This gave me much ease # about 6 months before Vine came the Disipeldisciple visited Oxford & thro Br. Kenchin as his interpiterinterpreter spoke with all the awaken'd men at 6 in the morning. & with the women at 6 in the Even. & on his return to Germany he sent Br. Vine from thence to Oxford & soon after the Disciple Rotewrote ordering Br. Vine to see if I would move to Germany but if not then I should come to London.[deleted matter]
About this time Br. Vine was sent here by the Brn. in London to visit & preach & see what he could collect out of our Sociatysociety
On hearing this what Br. Vine Preach'd I lost my Curs. fear and Condemnation in the love of Jesus
about this time on a Whitsen Monday I & 13 more as by Appointment met

met, at a friends houshouse in the Cittycity where we had a feast of Love with singing. When Br. Vine prayed, all kneeling, at which time our Dr Saviour My Lord and My God Stood before me in His Mangel'dmangled, Suffering, Bleeding Form & Figuerfigure - and Spoke quite plaineplain to me these words (viz)
I have lov'd thee with an everlasting love, & none shall pluck
thee out of my Hands
This sight far above all Heavenly visions, or whatever can be nam'd at once, sav'd me, the which I believe & feel throthrough time & in eternity.
I from this unspeakable mercy & condesencioncondescension of my Dr. Saviour was light & happy as an Angel

div.head: Page 5
div.p: Angel â€” On my choosing reatherrather to stay in England thenthan go to Germany I being sent for soon after travilledtraveled to London where I liv.d about 9 Months [deleted matter]
with one Mrs. Nicolos when I was us'd as laboureslabours in my Choir when I enjoy'd unspeakable Happy Sesonsseasons in real Singleness of Heart

In the year 1740, 1 O.S. on Feb 5 I enter'd the Married State & on next March the 4th I with my Dr. Husband went on Board with the first sea Congregation for Pensylvania, this voyage as also travilling with our Saviour's People had been deeply imprestimpressed in Both our Hearts before we had any apprehension of changing our states
On this voyage I experienced much grief & sorrow principally ocassion'd throthrough & by my sister in law whose mean origenorigin I knew, we both being Born & & grown up in one Neighbourhood but

but now on her coming from the Congregation in Harrandike deny'ddenied That I knew her decent, & throthrough her unconverted, wicked mind, earnestly endeavour'd every way practicable to blemish, & hurt me.
But He who first say me lying in my Blood, continu'd the same near Friend oft repeating to my Heart the first comfortable words (viz)
I have loved thee with an everlasting love, & none shall pluck thee out of my hand
This I alwaisalways prov'd & found Efficatiousefficacious to soften & sooth each grief & trubletrouble, as also to quell each ouldold unlamblike passion

we Ariv'darrived by way of N. York in Philladelphia in JuneMay on AssentionAscension Day 41. here we say the Dr. Disipel whom throthrough our 3 month voyage we had so often wish'd to see, yea his being hearhere strengthen.d my inclination to follow him

on our coming as some of the first Settelerssettlers of Bethlehem in this yongyoung Congregation of which I had the Grace to become a Member as also not long after an Acqalut but before this I became a Member of

div.head: Page 6
div.p: of the Holy Communion. thothough at this time I understood little or nothing of German yet each Opportunity with the love I felt to the Geshwrs from that I felt to our Dr. Saviour in this young little Congregation exciting in me all willingness to help & assist where I could â€“ all was to me a coind of a nether Parradiceparadise

On December 24 this year the Desipeldisciple Journyingjourneying from Bethlmn to Philladelpa appointing us to follow him there from whence he sent us to Ne:Shamany where I with my Dr. Husband stayed 3 months so return'd to my Dr. Brn where I enjoy'd unspeakable blessings in singelnesssingleness of Heart. I alwaisalways found when as it sometimes happen'd that by somsome of my Sisters I was Accus'd for my over plainness our Dr. Saviour who had said he so loved me bore me through alwais maintaningmaintaining my credit by my labourers
In the year 44, I with my Dr Husband resided in the West Jarsees About 4 months in blessing, and soon
soon after were sent & liv'd with Capt Garrison on Staten Island staying with him till he himself was about to move, in all love
In 46 I with my Dr Husband resided for a time in Dansbury

In the year 48 in May I with my Dear Husband travil'dtraveled & mostly on foot to Shomoco where I seem'd near going home on a feavour from whence we return'd in Oct. just reaching Dr Bethlehem on the Eve of the Elders Fast, after which I became Congregation Servant.

about the year 51 in Johannas NitchmondsJohannes Nitschmann time I with my Husband recidedresided 7 months on Long Island from whence we mov'd a second time to Dansbury, where having been about one year we return.d & began the first Store in Bethn from whence I with my Dr Husband warewere (thothough on our side with the greatest reluctance) mov'd to Gnadenhitt where I liv'd about 9 Months in Fear with cenciblesensible apprehencon of

div.head: Page 7
div.p: of that which fell on us in the night on Nov 24 this was a heavy Night I had with my Dr Husband in the Woods wherein the Murdering Sprits & powers of Darkness pres'dpressed heavy

I being comforted & recover'd respecting this heavyness for 6 months in Dr Bethlehem, when with my Husband I travil'dtraveled to & recidedresided 3 year in N England where I enjoyed numberless blessings having the Grace to see there a Congregation settlel'dsettled by Dr Br Spanengb'g

being return'd from N England having rested 8 weeks in Bethn I with my Dr Dr Husband set of on my Birth Day Being Feb. 12. 1759 for Jamaica with My LosungObserve the Losong & Hymn on that Day from Br Spaningberg

here I lov'd & was lov'd by the poor Dr Negro slaves for near 6 years when at last the heat of the Country had so impaired my Dying boddybody that had I stay'd I shou'd soon have been at home with my lord but on Obeying our call to Bethn must undergo more then in this sea journey thenthan I expected to undergo & live five weeks

weeks without eating. Life being just preserv'd by Drink, but on my hearing we warewere not far from land my Spirits something reviv'd & I said well to Him all things are possible, He can only bring to pass what I so often have begg'd of him that my remains might rest with those of his people if not in Bethn yet with in Phillada where we ariv'd the 20th of Oct. where I was 5 Days in Dr Sister Nizers tender nursing care when I began to recover by means of eating what a Doctor who was sent for had in perticulerparticular forbid. I in these days so recover'd for a Waggonwagon on 27 of this instr. to Dr Bethn Here both I & our Dr Doctor Otto beliv'dbelieved I had travel'd my last pilger journey. Here now I had obtain'd & gained the greatest thing I Desier'ddesired on Earth. Often telling my only friend and Dr Saviour - now I am ready to leave this Clay & sink into the sea of thy mercy then thou hast Redeem'd and sav'd me by thy holy Blood - here throthrough the Care & love of my Dr Geshwr in the Bosom of the Dr Congregation free from each Remembrance I in the Space of 20 Months was much recover'd on

div.head: Page 8
div.p: On May 30. 1766 we being propos'd to visit Carrols Mannor in Maryland now it was more plain to me why I so far recover'd to him all the things are possible, here my decaying impar'dimpaired nature something hem'd & clog'd the the Spirit & longing of the mind for the Salvation of my fellow Creatuers

On June the 12. 66 we I with my Dr Husband set of for our appointed Plan where we ariv'darrived on July 14 Where we Aboad 6 years & 2 months lasting sweet & bitter, rejoicing with those that rejoyc'drejoiced & weeping with those who wept - In Feb: 72 as I lay verry Ill yea was so far reduc'd that I gave up the hopes of laying to rest my wore out Remainesremains in Dr Bethn. but out Dr Saviour ever remembering his promispromise of his first apperingappearing to me, heard me also herin.
